intro: Lepidagathis tisserantii, commonly known as the Tisserant's lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts.
